workflow.name: Build a WhatsApp assistant for text, audio & images using GPT-4o & Evolution API
workflow.description:
Build an intelligent WhatsApp assistant that automatically responds to customer messages using AI. This template uses the Evolution API community node for WhatsApp integration and OpenAI for natural language processing, with built-in conversation memory powered by Redis to maintain context across messages.

> ⚠️ **Self-hosted requirement:** This workflow uses the Evolution API community node, which is only available on self-hosted n8n instances. It will not work on n8n Cloud.

## What this workflow does

1. Receives incoming WhatsApp messages via Evolution API webhook
2. Filters and processes text, audio, and image messages
3. Transcribes audio messages using OpenAI Whisper
4. Analyzes images using GPT-4 Vision
5. Generates contextual responses with conversation memory
6. Sends replies back through WhatsApp

## Who is this for?

- Businesses wanting to automate customer support on WhatsApp
- Teams needing 24/7 automated responses with AI
- Developers building multimodal chat assistants
- Companies looking to reduce response time on WhatsApp

## Setup instructions

1. **Evolution API**: Install and configure Evolution API on your server. Create an instance and obtain your API key and instance name.
2. **Redis**: Set up a Redis instance for conversation memory. You can use a local installation or a cloud service like Redis Cloud.
3. **OpenAI**: Get your API key from platform.openai.com with access to GPT and Whisper models.
4. **Webhook**: Configure your Evolution API instance to send webhooks to your n8n webhook URL.

## Customization options

- Modify the system prompt in the AI node to change the assistant's personality and responses
- Adjust the Redis TTL to control how long conversation history is retained
- Add additional message type handlers for documents, locations, or contacts
- Integrate with your CRM or database to personalize responses

## Credentials required

- Evolution API credentials (self-hosted)
- OpenAI API key
- Redis connection

workflow.name: WhatsApp Multimodal AI Assistant with Evolution API

parameters.content:
## WhatsApp Multimodal AI Assistant

A complete AI-powered WhatsApp assistant that handles text, audio, images, and documents. Features message queuing, conversation memory, and smart response formatting.

### How it works
1. Receives WhatsApp messages via Evolution API webhook
2. Classifies message type (text, audio, image, document)
3. Processes media with OpenAI (transcription/vision)
4. Queues messages in Redis (waits for more messages)
5. AI Agent generates response with conversation memory
6. Formats long responses into multiple WhatsApp messages
7. Sends replies with natural typing delays

### Setup steps
- [ ] Install Evolution API community node
- [ ] Set up Evolution API + connect WhatsApp
- [ ] Configure Redis instance
- [ ] Configure PostgreSQL database
- [ ] Add OpenAI API credentials
- [ ] Set up webhook in Evolution API
- [ ] Replace `YOUR_ALLOWED_NUMBER` placeholder

### Customization
- Modify AI Agent system prompt
- Adjust message wait time (default: 10s)
- Change response formatting rules
- Add more message type handlers

## ⚠️ Requirements & Setup

**Services needed:**
- Evolution API (v2.2+)
- Redis (for message queuing)
- PostgreSQL (for chat memory)
- OpenAI API key

**Community Node:**
```
n8n-nodes-evolution-api
```

**Webhook Setup:**
1. Copy the webhook URL from "Receive WhatsApp" node
2. In Evolution API → Instance → Webhook
3. Enable: `MESSAGES_UPSERT`

**Credentials to configure:**
1. Evolution API (server URL + API key)
2. OpenAI API
3. Redis connection
4. PostgreSQL connection

## 4. Process Media

Handles audio transcription, image analysis, and document extraction

## 5. Message Queue

Accumulates messages and waits for more input

parameters.text: Describe this image received via WhatsApp. Be as detailed as possible and transcribe any visible text.

values.content: Describe this document received via WhatsApp. Be as detailed as possible and transcribe any visible text.

parameters.messageText: Sorry, I cannot process this type of message yet.

options.systemMessage: You are a friendly and helpful virtual assistant. Your goal is to help users solve their questions clearly and concisely. Do not make up information. If you don't know something, admit it.

messageValues.message:
# Instructions for Formatting Messages for WhatsApp

Act as an expert in digital communication specialized in WhatsApp Business. Your task is to take any long message and reorganize it into multiple messages optimized for WhatsApp, keeping ALL the original information.

## Formatting rules:

### General structure:
1. Message 1: Introduction + basic data (keep original greeting/context)
2. Message 2: Main features
3. Message 3: Services and policies

### Format of each message:
- Maximum 3-4 lines per message
- Use relevant emojis to make it more visual
- Keep the original tone of the message
- Do NOT lose any data: addresses, capacities, schedules, etc.

## Output format:
Always return a JSON with this exact structure:

```json
{
  "respuesta": [
    "First message text",
    "Second message text",
    "Final message text"
  ]
}
```

### Rules for JSON:
- Each array element is an individual message
- Keep logical order: intro -> features -> services -> call to action
- Do NOT add explanatory text outside the JSON
- Do NOT number the messages in the JSON

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
